name: 吳傳威
objective: This course is mainly aimed at introducing an energy approach to analyze structural systems.
schedule:
1st week Orientation and introduction
2nd week Historical remarks-- Mechanics / Variational mechanics
3rd week Eigen, displacement work, Betti’s Law, Maxwell theorem
4th week Strain energy / Complementary strain energy
5th week Energy theorems--Work equation
6th week Castigliano’s first and second theorems
7th week Polar coordinates, Non-uniform sections
8th week Nonlinearities-- Physical, geometrical, and load configuration nonlinearities
9th week Total potential energy / Calculus of variations
Euler-Lagrange equation
10th week Midterm exam.
11th week Ritz method -- Shape functions
12th week Boundary conditions topics
13th week Galerkin’s method
14th week Variational principles--Total complementary, H-R, and Hu-Washitsu variational principles
15th week Influence lines for indeterminate structures
16th week Linear theory of elasticity
17th week Matrix structural analysis--Flexibility method/Stiffness method
18th week Final exam.
scorePolicy:
1. Midterm Ex.       30%
2. Homework          20%
3. Class attendance  10%
4. Final Ex.         40%
materials:
1.Stress,Stability and Chaos in Structural Engineering: An Energy Approach, M.S.El Naschie, McGraw Hill.
2.Energy Principles in Structural Mechanics, T.R.Tauchert, McGraw Hill.
3.Class note.
